intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris batavorum, commonly known as the common chickweed, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, herbaceous habit with small, alternate leaves and white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits called silicles, which are typical of the mustard family. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
